publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3637 Margaret Jamieson: Food for Life School of the Year—That the Parliament congratulates Hurlford Primary School in Kilmarnock, the pilot school of East Ayrshire Council, on being awarded the Soil Association’s Food for Life School of the Year Award; recognises the commitment of the pupils and all staff in promoting and educating the pupils and their families to embrace Food for Life, and welcomes the recent decision of East Ayrshire Council to expand the pilot across a further 10 schools. Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
S2M-3637 Food for Life School of the Year (lodged on 28 November 2005) Donald Gorrie*

S2M-3637 Margaret Jamieson: Food for Life School of the Year—That the Parliament congratulates Hurlford Primary School, Kilmarnock, the pilot school of East Ayrshire Council, on being awarded the Soil Association’s Food for Life School of the Year Award; recognises the commitment of the pupils and all staff in promoting and educating the pupils and their families to embrace Food for Life, and welcomes the recent decision of East Ayrshire Council to expand the pilot across a further 10 schools. Supported by: Donald Gorrie
S2M-3637 Food for Life School of the Year (lodged on 28 November 2005) Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-3637 Food for Life School of the Year (lodged on 28 November 2005) Linda Fabiani*
S2M-3637 Food for Life School of the Year (lodged on 28 November 2005) John Swinburne*
